title: Trying to match old signage typeface
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114456im_/http:/typophile.com/files/high-grove-sign_6407.jpg)

I'm trying to find a typeface that closely matches the image above. It is a recent photograph of a sign that was created close to 30 years ago. The "R" is rather unique, but I can't seem to find a typeface that matches. Caslon and Jenson are close, but not quite right.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,  
Bill

Font: 

 Revival 565 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114456/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")
author: wlampkin

comments.content:
That |R| is indeed strange...  
**Revival 565** from Bitstream is somewhat close, though not an exact match:  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/revival-565/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114456/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/revival-565/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/revival-565/")

**[Dutch Mediaeval](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114456/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=CanadaType%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Dutch%20Mediaeval%20Pro%20-%20Regular&fid=dd8b9f864bee11475c60fb18722d9f9a&fsize=60&text=HIGHGROVE&wrap=2)** by Hans van Maanen [CanadaType, 2007] is a better match for |R| but the rest letters are off...

I’m not finding a match. If the sign was hand-painted, you may be dealing with a variation of Engravers:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/engravers-oldstyle-205/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114456/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/engravers-oldstyle-205/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/engravers-oldstyle-205/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/ol-engravers-classic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114456/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/ol-engravers-classic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ortizlopez/ol-engravers-classic/")

Another typeface that comes close, though not for the |R|:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/concorde-bq/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114456/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/concorde-bq/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/concorde-bq/")

I found similar |R|s in these typefaces:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/dutch-mediaeval/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114456/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/dutch-mediaeval/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/dutch-mediaeval/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/zilvertype-pro/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114456/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/zilvertype-pro/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/zilvertype-pro/")  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/erasmus-rr/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114456/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/erasmus-rr/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/erasmus-rr/")

It's a large, brass cast sign (3-feet by 9-feet?). The letters are raised, with the background dark. I converted the image to grayscale, upped the contrast, then inverted it to make the letters easier to read. I'm thinking it's not a standard print typeface, but something the sign makers had in their repertoire.

Revival 565 looks pretty darn close (though not quite). But I can still call that one a winner with a bit of modification!

Thanks!

Bitstream fonts were reissues of other foundries’ typefaces under new names; the original is Berling:  
 [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/berling/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317114456/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/berling/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/berling/")
